title: [Large-scale] Context-Based Geography Assessment Design and Implementation

context.prior_knowledge: Basic geography concepts comprehension, spatial analysis skills, and social phenomena interpretation experience
context.additional_context: Learners engage in developing and validating geography assessment tools through case analyses combining local spatial issues and historical contexts. Utilizes digital mapping tools and collaborative platforms in a BYOD environment.

learning_goals: Learners can design at least three contextualized geography assessment items based on actual local cases (urban areas, natural disasters, cultural landscapes, etc.)
Learners can validate the appropriateness of developed assessment items through peer evaluation across two or more spatial-temporal contextual dimensions
Learners can write comprehensive reports connecting geographical concepts with real-world phenomena by analyzing simulated field survey data

resources: Geospatial Statistical Datasets (Population, Climate, Land Use)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
